section.p: In a typical software development environment, many developers will be engaged in work on one code base. If everyone was to be allowed to edit and modify any development item whenever they felt like it, it should be obvious that chaos would tend to result while little productive work got done. Instead of suffering under such an environment, most developers prefer to implement version control tools such as the one described here. Version control tools allow an individual developer to maintain control over an item such as a source file while they implement and test changes to it.
